stages.title: Methodological Framework
stages.bullet_one: Sampling criteria and selection procedures were defined using a stratified approach to ensure representation across relevant consumer segments.
stages.bullet_two: A comparative framework was developed to evaluate products associated with established mother brands against standalone non-mother brand alternatives.
stages.bullet_three: Key outcome metrics were specified, and standardized procedures for data collection were formalized.
stages.description: The initial stage established the methodological structure of the study.

stages.title: Construction of the Storefront
stages.bullet_one: An interactive, web-based platform was designed and implemented to simulate a standard online purchasing interface.
stages.bullet_two: The primary outcome was a functional, realistic storefront that enabled controlled observation of consumer choices during the experiment.
stages.description: This stage focused on developing the experimental environment required to replicate a realistic shopping context.

stages.title: Pilot Testing
stages.bullet_one: Initial trials were conducted to evaluate the flow, clarity, and effectiveness of the experimental protocol.
stages.bullet_two: Technical, procedural, and participant-related issues were documented and analyzed.
stages.bullet_three: Adjustments were implemented based on pilot findings to improve reliability, minimize bias, and ensure readiness for the full experiment.
stages.description: This stage validated the experimental procedures prior to full deployment.

stages.title: Experiment Execution
stages.bullet_one: The study was conducted across predefined consumer segments in accordance with the finalized protocol.
stages.bullet_two: All required data points were collected using standardized procedures to ensure accuracy and consistency.
stages.bullet_three: Quality controls were applied throughout the process to maintain protocol compliance and data integrity.
stages.description: This phase involved the systematic implementation of the finalized experimental design and primary data collection.

stages.title: Analysis
stages.bullet_one: Statistical methods were applied to test hypotheses and derive evidence-based conclusions.
stages.bullet_two: Models were developed to estimate preference shares, define segmentation thresholds, and identify sentiment themes.
stages.bullet_three: Results were synthesized into actionable insights for corporate and policy decision-making.
stages.description: In this final stage, collected data were analyzed and translated into operational and strategic insights.
